labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Better Auth Server" is primarily focused on secure and enhanced authentication capabilities. Its core functionality includes enabling seamless integration of authentication workflows with LLM applications, improving security and user management. The available tool "get-library-docs" suggests it also supports fetching documentation, which could be related to authentication protocols or libraries. The server aims to simplify authentication processes through standardized protocol interactions.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Security & Authentication" is chosen because the server's main functionality revolves around authentication, security, and user management. Secondary label "API Integration" is selected due to the need for seamless integration with other applications. The "Development Tools" secondary label is included because the tool "get-library-docs" indicates support for accessing documentation, which is often used in development workflows. A custom label is not needed as the predefined labels cover the server's functionality adequately.

tools.name: get-library-docs
tools.description: Fetches up-to-date documentation for a library.

tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens of documentation to retrieve (default: 10000). Higher values provide more context but consume more tokens.

server_info_crawled.name: Better Auth Server

server_info_crawled.overview: Provide secure and enhanced authentication capabilities through a dedicated MCP server. Enable seamless integration of authentication workflows with LLM applications, improving security and user management. Simplify authentication processes by leveraging standardized protocol interactions.

tools.name: get-library-docs
tools.description: Fetches up-to-date documentation for a library.

tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens of documentation to retrieve (default: 10000). Higher values provide more context but consume more tokens.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Kinfe123/better-auth-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
